club.name: Leo Lions Club of Colombo Uptown Eminence
club.tagline: We Lead. We Serve. We Uplift.
club.description: A dynamic Leo club igniting youth leadership through service, creativity, and meaningful impact.

about.mission: To empower youth through leadership development and community service that creates lasting positive change.
about.vision: To be the leading youth organization fostering innovation, service, and excellence in everything we do.
about.values: Integrity, service, excellence, and collaboration guide every initiative we undertake.

clubCouncil.name: Leo Lion Anuk Nisalitha
clubCouncil.biography: Leo Lion Anuk Nisalitha is an accomplished environmental leader, scout, and emerging entrepreneur recognized for his vision, leadership, and commitment to meaningful change. A proud alumnus of Ananda College, he has distinguished himself through a blend of leadership, innovation, and an unwavering commitment to creating a greener and more compassionate world.
clubCouncil.background: From his formative years, Anuk demonstrated an innate ability to lead. His educational journey at Ananda College was marked by academic excellence and environmental activism. He served as President of the Ananda College Environmental Society (ACES), Secretary of the Marine Association, and Scout Group. As a Leo, he served as Assistant Secretary and Director Panelist, spearheading impactful initiatives. He is also a co-founder of sustainable enterprises aligning profitability with purpose.

clubCouncil.name: Leo Lion Vihandu Wanniarachchi
clubCouncil.biography: Leo Lion Vihandu Wanniarachchi is an academically accomplished leader and scout, currently an undergraduate deeply committed to leadership and community service through LLCCUE and Leo Club of Nawala Metro.
clubCouncil.background: A proud alumnus of Ananda College, Colombo, he completed his education with outstanding scholarly achievements and school colors. He rose to the pinnacle of scouting, earning the President's Scout Award. He served as President of the Marine Association and VP of the All Island Environmental Society.
achievements: Gold Award for Marine Association Leadership
VP of the All Island Environmental Society

clubCouncil.name: Leo Lion Thusal Ranawaka
clubCouncil.biography: Leo Lion R.A. Thusal Ranawaka is a distinguished leader recognized for applying "Digital Transformation" to community service. As the Charter Secretary of LLCCUE and former Secretary of the Leo Club of Ananda College, he has redefined administrative excellence through technology and systems architecture.
clubCouncil.background: An alumnus of Ananda College (2012-2025), Thusal served in an unprecedented "Quadruple Secretaryship" role during the 2024/2025 academic year for the Leo Club, Environmental Society, Marine Association, and Quiz Club. He was a Google Code-in Finalist and achieved the President's Scout Award. His defining contribution was the development of the "Ananda Leos App." Currently, he serves as the Team Officer for Marketing and Digital Transformations for Leo District 306 D7.
achievements: Most Outstanding Digital Transformation Champion (Winner - District 306 C2)
Ananda College Colors Insignia for Scouting (2025)

clubCouncil.name: Leo Lion Rinoshi Nihara
clubCouncil.biography: Rinoshi Nihara serves as Treasurer, overseeing financial management and budget planning.
clubCouncil.background: Financial management background with expertise in budget planning.

districtOfficials.name: Lion A.P. Singh
districtOfficials.biography: A.P. Singh, of Kolkata, India, was elected to serve as international president of Lions Clubs International at the association’s 107th international convention, held in Orlando, Florida from July 13 through July 17, 2025. He is a practicing chartered accountant and has family business interests in automobile dealerships.
districtOfficials.background: A Lion since 1984 and a member of the Calcutta Vikas Lions Club, he has held many positions including district governor and council chairperson. He has served as GMT international coordinator, chairperson for the 2017 DGE seminar, and faculty at numerous leadership institutes. He has also served as multi-national coordinator for Campaign SightFirst II and CA leader for Campaign 100.

districtOfficials.name: Lion Fabricio Oliveira
districtOfficials.biography: Fabrício Oliveira of Catolé do Rocha, Paraiba, Brazil, serves as chairperson for Lions Clubs International Foundation (LCIF) for 2025-2026. He is a businessman with a post-graduate degree in business management (MBA) from Fundação Getúlio Vargas (FGV) and a degree in business administration.
districtOfficials.background: A member of the Catolé do Rocha Lions Club since 1985, he has held several offices including International President, club president, zone chairperson, district governor, and international director. He has also served as secretary of industry and commerce of the state of Paraiba and administration council chairperson of several companies.
achievements: Ambassador of Good Will Award (Highest Honor)
Global Vision Medal for Campaign SightFirst

districtOfficials.name: Lion Shyana Jayalath
districtOfficials.biography: Lion Shyana Jayalath, Past District Governor and dynamic leadership voice within Lions International, currently serves as the Council Chairperson of Lions Multiple District 306 for 2025/2026. She makes history as the first Council Chair to lead the newly expanded 12-district Multiple District—a milestone in Sri Lankan Lions history.
districtOfficials.background: Her leadership journey began in the Leo movement and reached historic heights as President of the Lions Club of Colombo (Host), where she led the club to its first “Most Outstanding Club” award in six decades. As District Governor of 306A1, she reinvigorated the district with her theme “Believe in the Power of One.” Today, she leads with vision, action, and an element of fun.
achievements: First Council Chair of expanded MD 306
New Voices Global Winner in Marketing
Lady Lion of the Year for MD 306

districtOfficials.name: Lion Gaya Upasena
districtOfficials.biography: Lion Gaya Upasena serves as the District Governor for 306 D7. He is the Managing Director at Power Lanka Pvt Ltd and an acclaimed specialist in the field of Power Generation with over 25 years of industry experience.
districtOfficials.background: An alumnus of Dharmapala and Nalanda College, he holds a Diploma in Automobile Engineering. He served 10 years at the Ministry of Defense, Sultanate of Oman. A charter member of Udahamulla Metro (2012), he is the mastermind behind the District Website, Mobile App, and online evaluation system. He is also a Founder Member of BNI Inspire Chapter.
achievements: Most Innovative, Popular, and Dedicated Lion accolades
Developed District Website and Mobile App
Extended two new Lions Clubs and sponsored two Leo Clubs

districtOfficials.name: Lion Ranjith Fernando
districtOfficials.biography: Lion Ranjith Fernando began his Lions journey while serving as a Branch Manager at Seylan Bank. Professionally, he built a distinguished career in banking, playing a key role in establishing the Leasing Unit at People’s Bank, before moving to Seylan Bank and later venturing into the printing and packaging industry as a successful entrepreneur.
districtOfficials.background: Academically, he holds a Bachelor of Commerce from the University of Sri Jayewardenepura, is an Associate Member of the Institute of Bankers, a finalist of the Institute of Chartered Accountants of Sri Lanka, and has pursued further studies in Japan and India. He also served as President of MASCO 85 of his alma mater. His leadership extended into the printing industry, where he became President of the Sri Lanka Association of Printers and represented the country at international forums. In Lionism, he rose through the ranks with dedication, serving in many cabinet roles, and publishing four acclaimed books on leadership and Lions governance.
achievements: Leadership Medal from International President Douglas Alexander
Established Dialysis Center at KDU Hospital (Rs. 40 million)
Membership Hero Award & Membership Rockstar Award (2025)

districtOfficials.name: Lion Chandika Dedigama
districtOfficials.biography: Lion Chandika Dedigama is a professional trainer and former Major in the Sri Lanka Army, where he was awarded the Rana Sura Padakkama for bravery. He has climbed the professional ladder to serve as Director/CEO in the government sector and Director of HR in the private sector.
districtOfficials.background: Educated at St Benedicts College and KDU, he holds a Master’s from University of Moratuwa. He has trained over 30,000 employees across 250+ programs globally. A Lion since his Leo days in 1985, he joined Kottawa Metro in 2005 and has served the cabinet for 10 years in various capacities.
achievements: Rana Sura Padakkama for Bravery (SL Army)
Director of HR at Capital Maharaja
Lead Trainer in SYIB and Master Trainer in Outward Bound

districtOfficials.name: Lion Viduranga Maddumage
districtOfficials.biography: Lion Viduranga Maddumage MJF is the dynamic Second Vice District Governor of Lions District 306 D7 and the Managing Director of Madduma Machinery, a prestigious organization with a 55-year history.
districtOfficials.background: A product of Dharmapala College (Head Prefect 1998/2000), he holds a Diploma in HR Management. Since joining in 2000, he has dedicated 25 years to selfless service. One of his most notable contributions is the donation of a fully equipped ward to the Nawinna Ayurveda Hospital.
achievements: Most Outstanding District Chairperson in the World
Donated a fully equipped ward to Nawinna Ayurveda Hospital
25 Years of Selfless Service in Lionism
Active participation in global conventions across 7 countries
Former Head Prefect of Dharmapala College

projects.name: Aurum'25
projects.title: Charter Installation
projects.description: Historic milestone marking LLCCUE's official chartering and installation of the inaugural Board of Officials.

projects.name: BRANDBOOST360
projects.title: Digital Marketing Basics
projects.description: Hosted in collaboration with Leo Club of St. Joseph’s College Anuradhapura and Lions Club of Anuradhapura City. Conducted by Leo Lion Pahan Ruchiranga, equipping young entrepreneurs with essential online presence knowledge.

projects.name: Beach Cleanup
projects.title: Coastal Preservation
projects.description: A successful cleanup project at Wellawatta Beach, uniting members to protect the environment and raise awareness on preserving coastal ecosystems.

projects.name: Ashirwada Pooja
projects.title: Blessings Ceremony
projects.description: A spiritually enriching ceremony held on 24th October 2025 to invoke blessings for the club’s future endeavors and seeking divine guidance for the upcoming Leoistic year.

projects.name: Project Suwadivi
projects.title: Hospital Renovation
projects.description: Compassionate initiative uplifting the environment of the Paralyzed Patients’ Ward at Ayurvedic Hospital, Rajagiriya through repainting and renovation.

projects.name: Danumata Athwalak
projects.title: Educational Support
projects.description: Community-focused initiative providing essential stationery items to underprivileged schoolchildren to empower their academic journey.
